1454536912849408001.text: The scatter-gather pattern in the API Gateway was the precursor to the Backend-for-Frontend pattern. The former is _still_ a viable option often at lower cost.

1454536160588402689.text: In 2012, I co-presented a Webinar we called The New 3-Tier Architecture. It has been almost 10 years, and it’s incredible how much this still rings true. Frontend -> API Gateway -> APIs. https://t.co/ZmKbg14tog

1454260203705167875.text: When we talk about API-first, it’s more than just domain modeling. We are building networked applications, distributed systems. The contracts are influenced by the architecture. It’s the combination of multiple disciplines that make this successful.

1454257191473479686.text: We could probably do a meaningful breakdown of different technologies using these thoughts as a guide. What’s the impact of GraphQL vs an API with materialized views? How much behavior should move to the client-server interface given evolution requirements? And so on.

1454252067422302213.text: It’s important to understand this when designing your data transfer mechanism—the API. What compromises will you make on state ownership, storage, and compute?
